items.label: 539fc874ec4f024d2f53e6c0
items.description:
The monthly Availability Charge is $15.68. It will apply to every bill. This fee allows us to properly maintain and service the 500-plus miles of power distribution lines, thousands of home service lines, and all of the associated equipment in the AUB power system. The fee directly contributes to helping us keep our energy usage charge as low as we can in the market. For a detailed explanation of the Availability Charge click here.

AUB buys all of its power from TVA. TVA dictates what type rate schedules AUB can have. TVA uses a Seasonal Rate Schedule that has different base rate levels depending on the season. For instance, there are four Summer Season months in the rate schedule (June - Sept), four Winter Season months (Dec - March) and four Transition Season months (April/May and Oct/Nov). Base per kilowatt hour rates are highest in the Summer months and lowest in the Transition months. That coincides with the cost to produce the power, i.e., demand for power and production costs to meet that demand are highest in the summer and lowest during mild spring and fall months.
items.name: Electric Power Rates - Residential
